Empires & Puzzles Errin Review: The Astral Dwarf Toymaker

Errin brings a unique kit to the 4-star arena with fast-speed Soul Connection and damage amplification. Originally plagued by a self-dispelling quirk, the v82 update has unleashed her true potential. Discover how this Astral Dwarf can transform your Challenge Event scores and dominate 4-star tournaments.
Errin Review: The Toymaker Who Ties Enemies in Knots
Errin, The Astral Toymaker: Soul-Binding Speedster

Errin is a 4-star Holy hero from the Astral Dwarfs family, released in mid-2025. As a Cleric class hero running at Fast mana speed, she occupies a very specific and highly coveted niche: a damage amplifier who can link enemies together to maximize the impact of your attacks. While she doesn't deal direct damage herself, her ability to turn the enemy team into a single, vulnerable unit makes her a "force multiplier" in the truest sense.

For a while after her release, Errin was the subject of a rather frustrating interaction where her own family bonus would dispel her primary status effect. However, with the v82 update changing how Soul Connection functions (treating it as an ailment on enemies rather than a buff), she has finally taken her place as a reliable and powerful support hero. She is essentially a Fast mana 4-star version of heroes like Franz or Wilbur, tailored for aggressive playstyles.

Errin's design is distinctively "Astral Dwarf," featuring the signature deep blue skin and intricate, somewhat eccentric attire. As a "Toymaker," she sports a pair of complex, multi-lensed spectacles and holds a carving tool, suggesting she is crafting the strange wooden mask floating in her hand. The art is detailed and colorful, with a whimsical yet slightly uncanny atmosphere. It perfectly captures the vibe of a master crafter who might be a little too obsessed with her creations. You wouldn't want to be one of the "toys" she decides to tie together.

Errin's stats are quite robust for a 4-star hero, reflecting the power creep of the mid-2025 era. With a base power of 742, she sits comfortably above older 4-star heroes and competes well with recent releases.
Decent, though less critical since she doesn't deal direct damage. It does help with tile damage in Holy stacks.
A solid defensive stat that ensures she can survive long enough to fire her skill.
Her health pool is excellent, providing substantial durability.
When Limit Broken (LB2), her stats balloon to nearly 1000 Defense and over 1600 Health, making her incredibly sturdy for 4-star tournaments and even allowing her to survive hits from 5-star Titans.
Errin's special skill is the centerpiece of her kit.

Linking all enemies so they share received damage is a powerful mechanic usually reserved for slower heroes or specific 5-stars. At Fast speed, this is devastating. It allows you to bypass high-defense tanks by hitting softer targets, or simply whittle down the entire enemy team simultaneously.

The +25% increased damage received is a strong debuff. In a meta where minions and mega minions are common, this can scale up to +50%, which is massive. Even at the base 25%, it significantly softens up targets for your hitters.

Previously, Soul Connection on enemies was treated as a "buff," which meant Errin's Astral Dwarf family bonus (which dispels enemy buffs) could accidentally wipe out her own special skill. The v82 update corrected this logic, classifying the enemy-cast Soul Connection as an ailment. This change was a massive quality-of-life improvement, ensuring Errin no longer sabotages her own setup.

Family Bonus, Passives, Aether Power & Unique Abilities
The Astral Dwarfs are loaded with extras that make them incredibly annoying to fight against and durable to use.

The dispel chance is excellent for keeping enemy buffs in check without using a turn. The resistance to mana reduction is a lifesaver against heroes like Alfrike or Waterpipe, ensuring Errin keeps her Fast speed advantage.
Errin ignores minions completely. While she doesn't hit, this likely applies to tile damage, which is a nice bonus.
She takes no damage from minion hits or status effects (like bleeding or poison from minions). This makes her very tanky against summoner-heavy teams.
A self-cleanse for fiends is a great utility, keeping her health pool intact.
is a decent defensive Aether Power. Since Errin is often a priority target due to her annoying debuffs, punishing enemies for hitting her adds some passive damage output to her kit.

Upon release, Errin was viewed with skepticism primarily due to the "self-dispelling" interaction. Players recognized the potential of a Fast "Franz-lite," but the unreliability made her a risky pick for competitive events.
Her stats are strictly modern. She outclasses classic 4-stars by a wide margin in survivability. Her mechanic (Soul Connect + Damage Amp) is rare at the 4-star level, keeping her unique.
With the v82 update, Errin is

. She is a top-tier pick for Challenge Events (Epic tier) and Alliance Quests, where clearing waves quickly is key. In 4-star Tournaments, especially Rush Attack and Bloody Battle, she is a menace. She hasn't just aged well; she effectively got a massive buff months after release.
As a Cleric, Errin has the Manashield talent, which gives a chance to resist mana negative effects. This synergizes perfectly with her family bonus, making her nearly immune to mana control.
Maximizes her survivability. Her job is to cast her ailment and survive. She deals no direct damage with her special, so Attack stats only benefit tiles.
Lower tile damage against Titans or in mono stacks.
Increases tile damage, which is multiplied by her own damage amplification debuff.
path (Defense/Health) is recommended. You bring Errin to facilitate other heroes' damage, not to deal it herself. Keeping her alive to fire twice is far more valuable than slightly stronger tiles.
Applies critical debuffs quickly, often before the enemy can set up defenses.
+25% to +50% damage is huge for Titans and high-score event runs.
Allows snipers to become AoE hitters and helps clear boards evenly.
Passive immunity to minion effects and self-cleanse for fiends makes her durable against specific metas.
Now functions correctly without dispelling her own ailments!
She is purely a support hero. If she is the last one standing, she cannot win the match alone.
Her value is directly tied to the damage output of her allies.
In defense, she can be ignored until she fires, unlike a hero who threatens immediate damage.
Essential for the Epic tier. Pair her with hit-all heroes to wipe waves instantly.

The damage increase stacks with standard defense down and elemental defense down. She is a great substitute if you lack a specific damage booster like Guardian Gazelle or Miki (for 4-star restrictions).
Very strong, though her Fast speed is less of an advantage here.
Excellent. Soul Connection spreads damage, and enemies can't heal it back.
Useful for the damage boost if you are restricted on hero choices.
The goal with Errin is to fire her
Fire Errin to link enemies and increase damage. Fire your attack booster. Then unleash Colen or Li Xiu. The shared damage combined with the AoE hit usually results in an instant wave clear.
Jackal provides Elemental Def Down, Errin increases damage taken, and Wu Kong boosts tile damage. The combination creates massive weak spot hits.
Rigard or other cleansers can wipe Errin's ailment instantly, neutralizing her turn.
Heroes like Garnet or Vanda who block ailments prevent Soul Connection from landing.

if you are relying on his defense down, as they overwrite the shared damage buff/ailment portion (though they work differently now, stacking the damage amp is the goal, but the shared damage mechanic doesn't "double up").

Errin is a fantastic pull. She acts as a "mini-Wilbur" or "mini-Franz," two of the most versatile heroes in the game. Prioritize leveling her for your Titan team and Event team. She will help you complete difficult quest stages by letting you kill bosses evenly rather than one by one.
You likely have Franz or Buster for 5-star content, but Errin is best-in-slot for
. If you compete in Challenge Events, she is mandatory for pushing top scores in the Epic category. Do not sleep on her just because she's a 4-star.
The community's relationship with Errin has been a roller coaster.

"It is hilarious to me that this hero is still out there dispelling her own special skill 3.5 months later." Players were incredibly frustrated, calling her "broken" and "useless" because her family bonus would wipe the Soul Connection.
The mood shifted dramatically. "The new Soul Connection changes... are expected to be very helpful." Players now recognize her as a key piece for competitive play.
"Not every Hero is PvP Hero." Users correctly identified that her strength lies in Events and Titans, urging others not to judge her solely on Raid Defense performance.

Errin started as a buggy curiosity, a toy that didn't quite work right out of the box. But with the v82 update, she has been polished into a precision instrument. She offers a rare and powerful set of debuffs at Fast mana speed, making her invaluable for boosting damage scores and clearing mob waves efficiently. While she may not be the flashiest hero in a raid defense, in the hands of a strategic player, she is an absolute gem.
A specialized tool that performs its job perfectly. Keep her, level her, and watch your Titan hits and Event scores soar.
At the time of this review, Errin does not have a costume. Her base version is strong enough to stand on its own merits.
